body.name: Two Nights with the Beastly Marquess: A Historical Regency Romance Novel (The Matchmaking Games Book 4)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jason and Augusta
reviews.reviewText: This is another story in Ms Byrne’s matchmaker series. Jason and Augusta are paired by the matchmaker, each having their own personal reasons for doing so. This leads to their marriage, which is the primary focus of the story. I truly enjoyed this story and the primary characters. The author created a well defined plot, and added drama, secrets, emotional barriers, and interferences from nefarious characters, which kept me engaged and invested in Augusta and Jason’s path and future. Each character has their crosses to carry. Augusta is trying to quickly find a match to avoid a scandal from being dumped three days before her wedding, and Jason, suffering from PTSD, from his time in the war. These barriers cause the couple to keep an emotional distance, not wanting to show each other their vulnerability. This is a fast paced story, that kept my attention from the first page, and does include a few spicy scenes. The characters are portrayed brilliantly, and the obstacles that they need to overcome are crafted wonderfully. The only issue I was a bit confused about was the title of the story. “Two nights….” doesn’t seem to match the story’s plot. But I still highly recommend this book. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love Overcomes Adversity
reviews.reviewText: Jason had been injured in the war and suffered from terrible nightmares. Seeing how happy his friends were who got married and with encouragement from his mother he spoke with Maria Webster, the matchmaker. Augusta was supposed to marry the Earl of Rueford but he backed out three days before their wedding. Her family afraid of the scandal told her they were going to have the matchmaker find her a husband. Now Jason, being in the military, was rather abrupt in his demeanor and so Augusta was rather taken aback by his manners. However, she did see that there was more to him than met the eye and that she was feeling an attraction to him that she had never felt before in any other man. Once they got married Jason was captivated by Augusta but also scared to let his walls down as he was afraid he might hurt her if she was with him when he experienced his nightmares when asleep. We do have some very bad actors who try their best to disrupt their gradually growing attraction to each other. The betrayals that happen do hurt but the two of them manage to overcome all of this and do find their happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The matchmaker puts together two people who want to be married. The heroine wants it because she was jilted and hopes to avoid a scandal. The hero wants it as he sees others happy in marriage, but he is unsure about revealing his nightmares. They start to open up to each other, but other characters interfere. It was a good read with enough twists to keep me going.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unlikely Love, Treachery Within
reviews.reviewText: Lady Augusta has been dumped 3 days before her wedding. Now scandalized she goes to the match maker in hopes to find someone to go ahead and marry to keep the scandal on the low. The matchmaker matched her with the Marquess of Oakhampton wanting a bride but due to his scarring from war and his abrupt manner he knows that it will not be easy. Unknown to the duke Augusta finds him interesting, but he feels there is no way she would want to be near her. He agrees to marry her but tries to keep his distance which with the sexual tension between them this is getting harder for both of them. Only if others would leave them alone to work out their relationship. But there are forces working to try to separate them, when neither wants it. ARC Review

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Augusta was jilted a couple days before her wedding and is facing social ruin. In desperation she goes to the matchmaker for help. Jason is a Marquess that has been scarred in the war and is expected to marry but women are afraid of his scars. They get matched and meet. She’s not afraid but finds him intriguing. A few are not pleased but the two find they like each other! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Healing a broken heart
reviews.reviewText: Lady Augusta is on the verge of social ruin after being jilted for no reason by her fiancé. Desperate to save face, Augusta's mother takes her to see Marie Webster, matchmaker extraordinaire.That evening, while enduring whispers and gossip, Augusta meets Jason, mysterious Marquess of Oakhampton, who introduces himself as Augusta's match. Despite the war hero's scarred appearance and her mother's obvious disapproval, Augusta finds herself drawn to him and agrees to marry him; however her new husband seems determined to keep her at arm's length.HEA, steamy, marriage of convenience, standalone, no cheating.I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was promising to start. I liked the banter between Augusta and Jason. It was obvious where the relationship was going. The whole situation with her mother and the Earl was very disappointing, and she seemed smarter than to fall for all the schemes so easily. It just seemed so naive and out of character, and it took away from her character.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: NOT ALL SCARS ARE VISIBLE - SOME YOU NEVER SEE BUT THEY ARE THERE
reviews.reviewText: LADY AUGUSTA - One of three sisters, not in any hurry to marry she insisted her two sisters Marry before she did.Her father was quite laidback left everything to his wife.(very opinionated and rude - worries only on what the Ton think.LADY AUGUSTA betrothed to William Earl of Rueford who arrived three days before their wedding informing her he could not marry her. Worried as to how her mother would react due to the gossip it would cause within society Not how her daughter would be feeling, she insisted they visit a MATCHMAKER immediately - to hopefully avoid gossip.JASON - MARQUESS OF OAKHAMPTON has avoided society since returning from the war tormented and badly scarred not just physically, people gossip about him all the time, barely leaving his estate - his mother says he needs a wife, his friend tells him of Marie Webster a Matchmaker who is successful in matching couples, whom have had successful marriages his friend being one of them.Marie Webster matches Lady AUGUSTA and JASON.ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS JASON AND AUGUSTA BRILLIANT CHARACTERS INTERACTION BETWEEN THEM IS 🔥 HOT .FEW SURPRISE ONE VERY NASTY WILLIAM EARL OF RUEFORD ALONG WITHAUGUSTAS EVIL MOTHER PLAN SOME BAD THINGS..I COULD NOT PUT THIS DOWN - EVERY PAGE had SOMETHING HAPPENING.READ IT YOU WILL LOVE IT. RECEIVED AN ARC COPY.

Jason and Augusta both have suffered traumatic experiences and a marriage of convenience is no guarantee things will turn out for the better. I liked how this book reminded us everybody deserves a second chance, but a stable relationship requires hard work, the will and the effort to get to know each other, the trust to show your true colors and admit to fears and weaknesses, the tolerance to allow the other one to be who he or she truly is. I enjoyed this wonderful read very much.

The next instalment of the matchmaking games! I liked the book, the plot was good, the characters were well developed and very likeable. Jason already appeared in the previous book in the series and I'm glad he got his own story. I enjoyed the chemistry between the two of them, especially the sparks that fly when they argue and their mutual attraction despite of it. There are a few steamy love scenes and a touch of intrigue to spice up the story.It was nice to meet some of the characters from the previous book again.Augusta, the diamond of the season and an obedient, poised daughter, was jilted by her fiancé just days before her wedding. To avoid another scandal, she must marry as soon as possible, and her mother insists on using the services of the matchmaker, Mrs. Webster.She doesn't like Jason at first sight, he is too commanding and she fears that they will never suit.Jason has been to war and returned scarred and traumatised, making him grumpy and reclusive in public but vulnerable inside.Although her mother tries to talk her out of marrying Jason, Augusta decides to marry him anyway. But his past and her scheming mother stand in the way of a happy ending...I recommend to all who like historical romance novels with marriage of convenience and opposites attract themes, grumpy heroes and poised heroines.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A lovely marriage of convenience story that grows into a deep love story where they come together to overcome adversity
